properties.areaDesc: Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso/Western Hudspeth Counties; Salt Basin; Otero Mesa; Northern Hudspeth Highlands/Hueco Mountains; Southern Hudspeth Highlands; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 10 at 4:57AM MST until January 10 at 8:00PM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...Strong winds move into the region this afternoon...

.An approaching upper level storm system will bring precipitation,
cooler temperatures and windy conditions to the area this
afternoon. Winds will continue to increase so that by this
afternoon winds in southern Otero and most of Hudspeth Counties
will be 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph. The rest of the area
will see wind speeds of 20 to 30 mph with some higher gusts. The
winds will begin to diminish as we move into the evening hours.

The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has
issued a Wind Advisory, which is in effect from 11 AM this
morning to 8 PM MST this evening.

* WHAT...Winds of 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph.

* WHERE...Southern Otero County in New Mexico and Hudspeth County
Texas.

* WHEN...Winds will continue to increase through morning and we
will see strongest winds from Noon through 8 PM this evening.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree
limbs could be blown down. The strong winds could make driving
difficult especially along north/south running roads.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Advisory means that winds of 35 mph are expected. Winds
this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high
profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING
